content: mini cockatiel final piece should measure approximately 2 5 tall difficulty easy this is an icrochetthings original pattern © 2014-2016 do not claim as your own do not copy sell or distribute this pattern do not sell any products made from this pattern materials key ▪ worsted weight yarn in yellow grey pink ▪ chain = chain ▪ felt in red ▪ single_crochet = single_crochet ▪ e hook 3 50 mm ▪ increase = increase ▪ stuffing ▪ decrease = decrease ▪ 6 mm safety eyes ▪ st = stitch ▪ scissors ▪ f/o = finish off ▪ tapestry needle ▪ = repeat ▪ felting needle ▪ = total number of stitches per row/ round © icrochetthings 2014-2016 body starting with yellow 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in 2st chain 6 2 increase around 12 3 single_crochet increase around 18 4 2 single_crochet increase around 24 5 3 single_crochet increase around 30 6 10 single_crochet around 30 break off yellow 11 15 attach grey single_crochet around 30 16 3 single_crochet decrease around 24 17 2 single_crochet decrease around 18 stuff and attach safety eyes i placed mine between rounds 7 and 8 at about 6 sts apart 18 single_crochet decrease around 12 19 decrease around 6 f/o sew shut 2 wings starting with grey 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in 1st chain 6 2 increase around 12 3 chain 3 single_crochet across chs slip_stitch in original st single_crochet in next st chain 2 single_crochet in chain slip_stitch in original st single_crochet in next st 7 f/o leave long tail for sewing long feather starting with yellow 1 chain 8 single_crochet across 7 f/o leave long tail for sewing short feather starting with yellow 1 chain 6 single_crochet across 5 f/o leave long tail for sewing © icrochetthings 2014-2016 assembly see pictures on next page if you need help with placement ▪ sew the wings on either side of the body ▪ sew the short feather on top of the head ▪ sew the long feather over the short feather ▪ use red felt to cut out 2 cheeks ▪ use the felting needle to secure the cheeks onto the body ▪ use pink yarn to embroider a beak and feet onto the body © icrochetthings 2014-2016 © icrochetthings 2014-2016
